hints.label: def-parallel-transport-fractal
hints.title: Parallel Transport on Fractal Set
hints.content:
755: :label: def-parallel-transport-fractal
756: 
757: For gauge field $U_e \in SU(N_c)$ on each edge $e$:
758: 
759: **CST edge** $e_p \to e_c$ (parent → child):
760: - Forward: $U(e_p, e_c)$
761: - Backward: $U(e_c, e_p) = U(e_p, e_c)^\dagger$
762: 
763: **IG edge** $e_i \sim e_j$ (undirected):
764: - Either direction: $U(e_i, e_j)$ or $U(e_j, e_i) = U(e_i, e_j)^\dagger$
765: 
766: **Path-ordered product** along path $P = \{e_0 \to e_1 \to \cdots \to e_n\}$:
767: 
768: $$
769: U(P) = U(e_{n-1}, e_n) \times U(e_{n-2}, e_{n-1}) \times \cdots \times U(e_0, e_1)
770: $$
hints.raw_directive:
752: ### 4.1. Path Tracing on CST+IG
753: 
754: :::{prf:definition} Parallel Transport on Fractal Set
755: :label: def-parallel-transport-fractal
756: 
757: For gauge field $U_e \in SU(N_c)$ on each edge $e$:
758: 
759: **CST edge** $e_p \to e_c$ (parent → child):
760: - Forward: $U(e_p, e_c)$
761: - Backward: $U(e_c, e_p) = U(e_p, e_c)^\dagger$
762: 
763: **IG edge** $e_i \sim e_j$ (undirected):
764: - Either direction: $U(e_i, e_j)$ or $U(e_j, e_i) = U(e_i, e_j)^\dagger$
765: 
766: **Path-ordered product** along path $P = \{e_0 \to e_1 \to \cdots \to e_n\}$:
767: 
768: $$
769: U(P) = U(e_{n-1}, e_n) \times U(e_{n-2}, e_{n-1}) \times \cdots \times U(e_0, e_1)
770: $$

hints.label: alg-wilson-loop
hints.title: Wilson Loop from IG Edge
hints.content:
832: :label: alg-wilson-loop
833: 
834: **Input:**
835: - IG edge $e = (e_i \sim e_j)$
836: - Fundamental cycle $C(e)$ (from Algorithm {prf:ref}`alg-fundamental-cycle`)
837: - Gauge links $\{U_{ab}\}$ on all CST and IG edges
838: 
839: **Output:** Wilson loop observable $W_e = \text{Tr}(U_C) \in \mathbb{R}$
840: 
841: **Procedure:**
842: 
843: 1. **Split cycle into segments:**
844:    - IG segment: $e_i \to e_j$ (via IG edge)
845:    - CST segment: $e_j \to e_i$ (via CST path)
846: 
847: 2. **Compute IG transport:**
848: 
849: $$
850: U_{\text{IG}} = U(e_i, e_j)
851: $$
852: 
853: 3. **Compute CST transport:**
854: 
855: $$
856: U_{\text{CST}} = U(P_{\text{CST}}(e_j, e_i))
857: $$
858: 
859:    Using path-ordered product from § 4.1
860: 
861: 4. **Multiply to close loop:**
862: 
863: $$
864: U_C = U_{\text{IG}} \times U_{\text{CST}}
865: $$
866: 
867: 5. **Take trace (gauge-invariant observable):**
868: 
869: $$
870: W_e = \text{Re}\left[\frac{1}{N_c} \text{Tr}(U_C)\right]
871: $$
